question: Which one of the following is a non-metallic mineral?
explanation: Gypsum is a non-metallic mineral. Gypsum is a soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate, with the chemical formula CaSO<sub>4</sub>· 2H<sub>2</sub>O. It is widely mined and is used as a fertilizer and as the main constituent in many forms of plaster, blackboard/sidewalk chalk, and drywall.
